column4: I just installed 12.04, how do i move the panel to the bottom and put the hide buttons on the side?
You can't, atleast for now.
please tell me thats a joke
which version was the last to let you do that?  I'm happy i found this out right after installing
Nope, reason is I guess because it would ruin the look and feel of Unity.
so how far back to i need to go to be able to get the customizeable version?
I don't think Unity can be customized like that, not even previous versions, maybe some hacks, but something nice and clean no.
there is a way, i had 10.something and you could customize it
pretty cool too, you could move the panels all to the bottom, hide them heck you could even make your own panels -yoiu would have liked it
10.04 LTS and 10.10 have Gnome 2.x as DE, Later versions use Unity.
i dunno i just download ubuntu not familiar with unity...
And Gnome 2.x is dead project now, but there exists now MATE which is fork of Gnome 2.x
so 10.10 is the last one to use the whatever it is tghat allows you to customize the panel?
10.10 is no longer supported.
If you really like Gnome 2.x use Ubuntu 10.04 LTS which will be supported until 2013 April. But you can install XFCE on Ubuntu 12.04 which is similiar to Gnome 2.x
thanks i think thats what im gonna do
Why don't you first try XFCE on Ubuntu 12.04, it's similiar to Gnome 2.x
before i go if i install it from a netbook is there anyway to force it not to do the netbook remix?
i have tried xfce on older ones i cant see it being better than gnome
Try MATE.
Try MATE, you can install it right there on 12.04. It's fork of GNOME 2.X
Try Cinnamon like they suggested, it's great and customizable.
